author: Digital Foundry
description:
Digital Foundry is now fully independent! Join the DF Supporter Program and support the team: https://bit.ly/3jEGjvx

Returning with its biggest technical evolution yet, the Borderlands series pivots to UE5 with mixed fortunes on console. On the plus side there's a genuine use-case for new features like UE5's Lumen and Nanite in Borderlands 4, but it's also clear that performance struggles. Specifically, PS5, PS5 Pro and Series X frame-rates degrade over continuous stretches of play, dropping down to the mid-30s in the extremes - where the fix is to quit the game and restart your save.

Go here to check out DF merch! https://store.digitalfoundry.net

00:00 Introduction
01:42 60FPS Performance Tested Over Time
04:26 Does Restarting the Game Help?
07:01 30FPS Quality Mode Tested
08:26 Perf vs Quality Mode Comparison
10:10 The PS5 Pro Advantage
12:05 Series S Cutbacks
13:16 Conclusion
title: Borderlands 4 Review - Yes, There Are Big Issues - PS5/PS5 Pro/Xbox Series X|S
